page.title: 01KIRKLEVINGTON
page.content:
{KIRKLEVINGTON & PICTON OUR DOMESDAY BLOCK IS LARGELY AGRICULTURAL THO IT IS FLANKED TO THE WEST BY A RAILWAY LINE AND TO THE EAST BY A DUAL CARRIAGEWAY _A19.TWO COMMUTER VILLAGES,KIRKLEVINGTON AND PICTON ARE THE MAIN FEATURES.THERE ARE SEVENTEEN FARMS IN TOTAL,TWO CHURCHES,TWO SCHOOLS AND ONE SHOP. KIRKLEVINGTON IS THE LARGER OF THE TWO VILLAGES.THE REMAINING AREA CONSISTS OF CULTIVATED FIELDS,THICKETS,THE SITE OF AN OLD BRICKWORKS,TWO PONDS AND TWO MINOR STREAMS. A SMALL SEWAGE WORKS EXISTS BEHIND ASH GROVE IN KIRKLEVINGTON.
CHILDREN FROM KIRKLEVINGTON PRIMARY SCHOOL HAVE COMPILED THIS INFORMATION DURING THE SUMMER TERM IN 1985.
